conditions.today: 6 AM—Good morning, Jackson Hole. Head for the Village, all you alpine adventurers, because Friday is dawning with the promise of boundless skies and spring-like temperatures. Following a brief inversion this morning, the highs will soar into the upper 30s on the deck of Corbet's Cabin and the mid-40s in the valley. A subtle touch from a south-southwest breeze will finish the scene as it blows between zilch and 10 mph. Often seductive and sometimes sedating, a little ski in the sunshine is always the right thing. So, don't even question it. It's not worth debating. Blow off work because a better time is waiting. -Lege
conditions.yesterday: 6 AM—Up and at 'em, Jackson. Attempting to deny the mountain's draw is an exercise in fall-line futility. So, slather on some sunscreen and get ready to spend the day snow-sailing the seas of Teton Tranquility. Solar rays will fall unabated through indigo skies, warming the atmosphere as they refract and radiate off the snowpack. Following a morning inversion, highs will make their way well into the 30s at the summit and into the mid 40s in the Village. Winds will be of the light and variable variety, highlighting the mellow vibe. Come out and cruise where the only power you need is gravitational. Whether your approach is recreational or that of a seasoned professional, the outcome is always something sensational. -Lege

recommendations: Fresh corduroy on Grand - perfect for intermediate skiers

morningBrief.headline: Is It the Weekend Yet?
morningBrief.body: 117 of 145 trails are open with 44 groomed. Variable conditions with a temperatures TBD. 117/145 trails open, 44 groomed. Variable conditions.
